cases.document_text:
COMPLETE BLOOD COUNT
WBC 12.5 K/uL (H)
Hemoglobin 9.2 g/dL (L)
Hematocrit 28.5% (L)
Platelets 245 K/uL
MCV 88 fL
MCH 29 pg
MCHC 33 g/dL

BASIC METABOLIC PANEL
Sodium 138 mEq/L
Potassium 6.1 mEq/L (H)
Chloride 102 mEq/L
CO2 24 mEq/L
Glucose 95 mg/dL
BUN 28 mg/dL
Creatinine 2.0 mg/dL (H)

CHEST X-RAY REPORT

Indication: Shortness of breath

Findings:
Mild cardiomegaly
No acute pulmonary infiltrates
No pleural effusion
No pneumothorax

Impression: Mild cardiomegaly, otherwise unremarkable chest X-ray

CT CHEST WITH CONTRAST

Clinical History: Evaluation for pulmonary embolism

Technique: Axial CT images through the chest with IV contrast

Findings:
No evidence of pulmonary embolism
Minor bilateral pleural effusions
Small mediastinal lymph nodes, likely reactive
No suspicious pulmonary nodules

Impression: No pulmonary embolism. Minor bilateral pleural effusions.

PROGRESS NOTE

Patient: 65-year-old male
Chief Complaint: Follow-up diabetes and hypertension

History of Present Illness:
Patient presents for routine follow-up of type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Reports good adherence to medications. No recent hypoglycemic episodes. Home blood pressure readings range 120-135/75-85.

Physical Examination:
Vital Signs: BP 128/78, HR 72, Temp 98.6F
General: Well-appearing, no acute distress
Heart: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs
Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally

Assessment and Plan:
1. Type 2 diabetes - well controlled, continue metformin
2. Hypertension - well controlled, continue lisinopril
3. Recheck HbA1c in 3 months
